docs.lead_paragraph: As a candidate for president, Newt Gingrich is criticizing some of the same health care programs that he supported as a consultant.

headline.seo: Gingrich’s Health Care Policy History at Odds With G.O.P.
headline.main: Gingrich Push on Health Care Appears at Odds With G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Gingrich Push on Health Care Appears at Odds With G.O.P.

docs.abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Newt Gingrich has been active in promoting recent programs that give the government a bigger hand in the delivery of health care, and benefit clients of his health care consulting business, including major drug makers and insurers; interviews and a review of records shows a candidate in direct contrast with his own efforts to appeal to Republican primary voters suspicious of big-government activism, especially in the realm of health care.
docs.snippet: As a candidate for president, Newt Gingrich is criticizing some of the same health care programs that he supported as a consultant.

docs.lead_paragraph: The specter of nursing strikes is looming on both coasts, with more than 6,000 nurses poised to walk out of three prestigious hospitals in New York City.

headline.seo: Nurses Threaten Strike at Three New York Hospitals
headline.main: Walkouts by Nurses Loom as Hospitals Seek to Cut Costs
headline.print_headline: Nursing Strikes Are Looming in the City as Hospitals Seek to Reduce Costs

docs.abstract: Over 6,000 registered nurses are poised to walk out of three of New York City's most prestigious hospitals, mainly over changes to their health benefits and what they say are strains in staffing; nurses, who are represented by New York State Nurses' Association union, say that they are disrespected by corporate hospital culture.
docs.snippet: The specter of nursing strikes is looming on both coasts, with more than 6,000 nurses poised to walk out of three prestigious hospitals in New York City.

docs.lead_paragraph: New jobless claims fell last week and the pace of factory activity in the mid-Atlantic and Northeast grew in November, despite a slump in auto production.

headline.main: New Data Offers Some Positive Signs for the Recovery
headline.print_headline: New Data Offers Some Positive Signs for the Recovery

docs.abstract: Labor Department reports number of Americans filing new claims for jobless benefits drops 19,000 to 366,000, lowest figure has been in three and a half years.
docs.snippet: New jobless claims fell last week and the pace of factory activity in the mid-Atlantic and Northeast grew in November, despite a slump in auto production.

docs.lead_paragraph: SPINOFF Covidien, the health care company run by José E. Almeida, below, that was carved out of Tyco International in 2007, plans to turn its pharmaceuticals unit into a stand-alone public company as it looks to increase shareholder value. Spinning off from its parent would give the new company ''the financial and strategic flexibility to pursue its growth plans,'' as well as allow it to bring new products to market, Covidien said in a statement. KEVIN ROOSE
docs.abstract: DealBook Online; Health Care company Covidien plans to turn its pharmaceuticals unit into a stand-alone public company; Goldman Sachs names Pete Lyon co-head of its investment banking unit that covers private equity firms; British insurer Old Mutual agrees to sell the Skandia Insurance Company to Swedish insurance company Skandia Liv for $3.2 billion; Credit Suisse will combine the support operations for its investment and private banking divisions as it looks to reduce costs against the backdrop of the sovereign debt crisis. Photos (M)

byline.original: By KEVIN ROOSE and MARK SCOTT

docs.abstract: A look at several of the social programs featured in this series that made progress in their mission to help others.
docs.snippet: A look at several of the social programs featured in this series that made progress in their mission to help others.

docs.lead_paragraph: The benefit of writing a column about solutions is that it provides an alternative lens through which to view the world. The daily news tends to be dominated by daunting challenges (unemployment, climate change, the polarization of Congress) and flashpoint events (the killing of Osama bin Laden, the tsunami in Japan, the Penn State scandal). These stories are vital to cover. However, people often come away from the news with a lot more information about problems than about how society is dealing with them.
docs.abstract: A look at several of the social programs featured here in 2011 that made progress in their mission to help others.
docs.snippet: A look at several of the social programs featured here in 2011 that made progress in their mission to help others.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bellevue Hospital Center celebrated its 275th anniversary Thursday with what one hospital official called a "conservative, restrained" noontime event, consonant with economic hard times, in the hospital atrium on the east side of Manhattan. Although a 275th birthday might not match up in gravitas to 200 years or 250 or 300, there is a word for it: dodranstricentennial.

headline.main: Bellevue Marks 275 Years of Taking Care

docs.abstract: Founded in 1736 with just six beds, the landmark is known for taking in the poor and uninsured, and many bold-faced names.
docs.snippet: Founded in 1736 with just six beds, the landmark is known for taking in the poor and uninsured, and many bold-faced names.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hollister and Porter Hovey took a Proustian approach to decorating a Brooklyn apartment, filling the space with memory-evoking pieces.

headline.seo: A Williamsburg Penthouse Marked With Memories — On Location
headline.main: A Williamsburg Penthouse Marked With Memories
headline.print_headline: Memories He Didn’t Know He Had

docs.abstract: Interior designers Hollister and Porter Hovey decorate the Williamsburg, Brooklyn, penthouse of music executive Peter Jenkins with unusual, memory-evoking vintage objects.
docs.snippet: Hollister and Porter Hovey took a Proustian approach to decorating a Brooklyn apartment, filling the space with memory-evoking pieces.

docs.lead_paragraph: A proposal by a Democratic senator and a Republican representative would make major structural changes to Medicare and limit the government’s open-ended financial commitment to it.

headline.seo: Lawmakers Offer Bipartisan Plan to Overhaul Medicare
headline.main: Lawmakers Offer Bipartisan Plan to Overhaul Medicare
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Offer Bipartisan Proposal to Limit Medicare Costs in Overhaul

docs.abstract: Proposal by Democratic Sen Ron Wyden and Republican Rep Paul D Ryan would make major structural changes to Medicare and limit the government’s open-ended financial commitment to it; just as important as details of the plan is the fact that the two are working together on an issue that both parties have exploited for political advantage.
docs.snippet: A proposal by a Democratic senator and a Republican representative would make major structural changes to Medicare and limit the government’s open-ended financial commitment to it.
